Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Breff449
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The breakfast is much better than the average with plenty of choice of both hot and cold food. The location is near perfect, within walking distance of the Reichstag, Unter Den Linden, and Museum Island etc. Transport links around the city and the airports are very good with Friedrichstrasse station less than 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 12shoes
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff are friendly, the location is central, the breakfast is impressive and the Wifi is free. If I was to have one small complaint it’s that the rooms are basic and the furniture is dated. But as I was here for work this last point was barely noticeable. I would recommend this for anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Central and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Jonoln
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distance of the Mitte, Unter Den Linden, Museuminsel, etc. A comfortable hotel in a quiet street with an excellent breakfast with a good choice of German ingredients. Good value and breakfast included in my booking. Thoroughly recommended for central Berlin. No working wifi in room and fixed connection difficult to operate but IT support not tried. Nice bar and restaurant (no tried) in the evening with discount for residents.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: TATraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was chosen as part of a business trip but stayed on for the weekend. The location is very good, situated in a quiet street leading down to the Spree river but also within walking distance of museums, Under den Linden and the S Bahn at Friedrichstrasse. Staff were efficient but friendly. Breakfast was a particularly good - wide ranging selection on a par with 5 star hotels. The only reason I have not given the room a higher rating is that they are obviously in the process of refurbishing the rooms and the room I had had not yet been done - nevertheless it was a good size and comfortable. I had a quiet room overlooking the courtyard (charmiing) but I think the rooms facing the road would have been fine as both streets were very quiet. At the end of the road and facing the river, there are a good range of restaurants, so no need to travel far to eat. The hotel restaurant also looked very good. Would recommend this hotel for the combination of location, friendliness and quality. It has a sister hotel across the road (Allegra) - worth considering if you can't get in at the Albrechtshof.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassreisende
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Albrechtshof is a nice hotel in Berlin-Mitte. The room was comfortable and quiet. There is a double door to the hallway to keep elevator noise out. It's on a side street, so the street noise isn't bad. The breakfast was good, although the service was somewhat lax. Generally, I found the front desk personnel also to be a little less friendly and service oriented than I'm used to in big city hotels. But for a 3-star hotel, it does the job: clean, centrally located and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel with excellent location and a wealth of restaurants in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mule54
Reviews.Content: Just across the Spree River from Fiedrichstrasse Station, this was the epitome of access to Berlin--either by train or by walking. The neighborhood is filled with good restaurants: Ganymede for a more upscale Frence Brasserie; KartoffelKeller for authentic potato dishes; an Italian restaurant just across the street; Indian and Argentina steps away. A wonder Arabic restaurant is just a couple of streets away on Claire Waldorf Strasse (but take cash); likewise with Thai food. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and the staff very accommodating. There is a quaint morning Matins room, Martin Luther Chapel, in the lower level to acknowledge Luther's visit in 16th century.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: capegirardeau
Reviews.Content: Close to Friedrichstrasse station, many restaurants, Humboldt University and Museuminsul. Room and bath small, but functional. Good breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, elegant rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: Friendliest service in the world, elegant rooms, great location. Wonderful breakfast with a great variety of food: yogurt, fruit, breads, cereal, eggs, cheese, fish. If your room is on the courtyard, you’ll hear the outdoor restaurant (in warm weather) during the day, though it’s kept closed 11pm - 8am -- unless the World Cup is on! (we didn’t mind, though).
